fields.description:
I have several remotes configured for a respository.  The default one is the project's main Stash repository, and in the Remote Details dialog the "default remote" box is checked.  The other remote is a personal/private working which is also located on Stash.

When I click the Pull button, the dialog that appears has the secondary (non-default) repository selected in the "Pull from remote" control and the current branch selected in the "Remote branch to pull" field.  If I change the remote then the selected branch is cleared and I have to manually select the branch again.

What I would expect to see is that the configured default remote is the one that is pre-selected in the dialog.
fields.summary: Pull dialog auto selects non-default remote

fields.description: see attach log
fields.summary: Reinstalled sourcetree after crash, now it crashes everytime that I uncheck staged files

fields.description:
I had just deleted a repository and recreated it in stash. I then deleted it an was going to reclone it in sourcetree. When I went to reclone my repository in sourcetree a received a notice that an update was available for sourcetree and would I like to apply it. So I responded yes but when source tree finished updating itself I tried to clone my new repository instance but sourcetree crashes each time I try. I had successfully performed the exact same sequence many times in the past prior to the update. But performing an update in the middle of my normal sequence of tasks has led to this problem.

I received a message from sourcetree that it had crashed which asked me to report this problem and to attach the sourcetree.log file.
fields.summary: Source tree crash after update

fields.description:
Made a clone of a project in a STASH server.
When clicking on an unstaged file SourceTree crashed with the error in de attached log file
The crash occurs when going through files in de Remotes/origin/master in a repo with a large amount of files.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed when

fields.description:
Using Standalone. I received a patch file for a mercurial respository on BitBucket. I opened SourceTree, set to the correct branch in my local copy. Then I opened the Apply Patch  .... menu item and browsed to find the patch. SourceTree crashed immediately on opening the patch.

I opened the patch using a text editor and it seems to be fine.
fields.summary: Crash on opening patch file

fields.description:
After someone has modified the history by using a Rebase, the SourceTree on other teammate's PC's will show many pushes and many pulls pending.

Now it's pretty easy to detect that you are on a different branch of history, and should just do a Fetch+Reset.

If SourceTree were to detect it automatically and offer a solution - it would be a big improvement for beginners on Git teams!
fields.summary: Detecting a changed history (after rebase by another teammate)

fields.description:
Since upgrade to 1.6.13 each loading of tree, opening menues, closing of the app...is taking up to 10 s --> almost unusable.

The attach shows:
- slow startup,
- slow refresh of tree after a commit (performed from git shell),
- slow exit.
fields.summary: 1.6.13 performance issues

fields.description:
It looks like Sourcetree is erroring out when trying to load repos. Two seem to be no longer associated with a git repo on my hard drive (not sure what happened there as they are projects I haven't opened in a few months) and the third is a project I added today. Sourcetree originally successfully connected and downloaded the project from a remote git repo when I added it but it crashes and the log is saying it can't connect now. 

Sourcetree just pops up the error dialog and closes every time on startup. There's no safe mode or way to remove the problem repos to fix the issue.
fields.summary: Crash on Startup

fields.description:
We are a team of four developers and each creates one branch per week.
After merging weekly, we want to keep the branches for a while.

However after a year, we now have way too much branches.
Therefore it would be handy to have a function which you could tell
"Delete all branches and remote branches that are older than X month".

That way we would not have to delete each branch manually, which is quite a lot of work.
fields.summary: Bulk Delete of old Branches

fields.description:
When a bunch a repositories need to be cloned in the context of a project, this can easily be scripted using straight git.

Afterwards these working copies need to be added in sourcetree. Doing this manually through the GUI is a long and tedious process. It is possible to edit the "bookmarks.xml" configuration file, but this would be very fragile.

Therefor this request to make this functionality available from the command-line. As far as I can see only 2 parameters are needed to add a working copy: the location of the working copy, and the location where the repository should appear in the bookmarks list.

(I would like to use this in the context of automating as much as possible the environment setup when someone new joins a development project.)

It is related to SRCTREEWIN-1250, but this is not about launching the GUI ready to clone a repo.. it is specifically about adding existing working copies in the sourcetree bookmarks list.
fields.summary: CLI improvement to register existing working copy in bookmarks list

fields.description:
We heavily use submodules in out build tree and changing to a branch is excruciatingly long because the default is to update submodules recursively.

It would be nice to be able to remove the --recursive option of the submodule update stage.
fields.summary: Have a setting to not update submodules recursively

fields.description: I own over 60 repository listed in my SourceTree, with that amount of items is difficult to locate either, so I suggest that is created a field that enables the search repositories.
fields.summary: Create field to find a repository

fields.description:
Sourcetree crashed (it seems while refreshing pending changes)
Tree view was on.

{code}

fields.description:
Sourcetree is showing Uncommitted changes but there's nothing to commit.

If I go to the console and enter git status shows that one folder has changed, but source tree doesn't show this and it doesn't allow me to switch branches unless I discard all.

But I when I discard all the change in the folder still persist and doesn't let met to swicht back between branches.
fields.summary: No Unstage or stage files but Uncomitted changes indicated

fields.description:
git log shows the correct time in 24-hour format, but the Date column and commit info in the Log / History tab in SourceTree shows "1 Jan 0001 0:00" for all commits after 13:00. This is very annoying because I have to open the terminal and navigate to a particular commit just to see the commit date.
The bug seems to indicate either that ST is trying to use 12-hour time against my wishes (which is Wrong) and can't handle my PM formatting string (which is also Wrong) or that it simply breaks on 24-hour times (obviously Wrong).
One interesting thing that recently happened was a commit at 12:22 in a time zone 3 hours ahead of me. That is something like midday for them and late morning for me. SourceTree shows "21:22" the previous day in the Date column. This is not only Wrong, but also incorrect. But at least it means ST can technically display 24-hour times -- it just refuses to unless it's confused.
fields.summary: SourceTree Date is Incorrect when system is set to 24-hour time

fields.description:
In dialog Options|Authentication it is possible to select multiple lines/entries.

When Editing or Deleting, only the entry which was selected first will be edited/deleted. 

All selected entries should be deleted. Editing should only be enabled if one entry is selected. Alternatively multiselection should be disabled.

When editing, you clearly state which entry will be edited ("enter password for [name of item]"). When deleting the dialog wants to confirm the deletion of the "selected password" (singular).
fields.summary: Multiselection of Saved Passwords not handled correctly

fields.description: When hitting commit SourceTree crashes, attached is the log. I think the GIT repo might be broken some how but I'm not sure?
fields.summary: Crash on commit

fields.description:
I am using SourceTree with one git repository that is a clone of a svn repo (it only has about a month of history)

When SourceTree starts up, everything works as expected but about 90% of the time after staging some files and committing everything grinds to a halt and I have to close and restart the app.

Sometimes this even happens after just staging a few files. I've tried Refreshing but that just brings up the "Loading..." message and it never returns.

I even have it set to Current Branch and not to show remote branches.

I don't *think* its the repo size as gitk is still really fast.
fields.summary: Refresh frequently doesn't work and requires restart of SourceTree

fields.description:
Prerequisites:
Superproject with staged file
Submodule with uncommitted change (staged or unstaged)

Steps:
1. Commit in superproject
2. SourceTree checks submodules, prompts that submodule has changes.
3. Click "Open" in submodule popup.
4. A "Commit" popup appears which misses a lot of text fields, buttons (Commit/Cancel) are unresponsive - see attachment.  It is not obvious whether this popup relates to the superproject or the submodule.

I have to close the repo tab and reopen to continue.

Workaround:
1. Manually commit change in submodule 
2. Commit in superproject (with or without the submodule ref change)
3. OK
fields.summary: During superproject commit with dirty submodule, pop up submodule commit dialog is unresponsive

fields.description: In SourceTree 1.6.13, the diff does not appear in the preview window, other than for uncommitted changes. Also, the external diff viewer is not called by Ctrl-D although it is set properly.
fields.summary: Diff does not appear

fields.description: I only wanted to mention it could be usefull to add programming specific words to the dictionary of Source Tree, because I would like Source Tree not to mark words like JFrame in a commit red.
fields.summary: Better dictionary

fields.description:
Someone(on Mac OS X) committed to git a filename containing an ampersand (&), which is an invalid character on Windows.  I have fixed the git repository so that I can pull it successfully on Windows, but when I select one of the old commits (by single clicking it) in the list of commits, SourceTree reliably crashes.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Open SourceTree
2. Select repository on left side of main window
3. Single click a commit before I removed the invalid characters from the repository.
4. SourceTree crashes.  "Oh dear."
fields.summary: Crash on invalid characters in paths in git commits

fields.description:
SourceTree has launched many runtime errors for any or no action performed.

A screenshot is attached.
fields.summary: SourceTree throws Runtime Error

fields.description: Update embedded git fails with error (see attachment)
fields.summary: Cannot update git

fields.description:
In standard context menu in file status tab was removed ignore command - is possible to get it back?
Thanks 
Petr
fields.summary: Return back ignore command to context menu in File Status Tab

fields.description:
When sorting unstaged files

Below is the complete files list files in a brand new asp.net mvc solution with two projects (picture also attached). Hard to read, but notice :

	Foo.Web/Foo.MVC/favicon.ico

fields.summary: Staged/Pending files, sorted on path, has strange behavior sorting '/' and '.'
Pending files, sorted by path, has strange unsorted behavior around

fields.description: If I enable Mercurial's shelve extension in my user configuration, SourceTree's Shelve function does not work reporting an error.  You should either change command names in your extension or disable Mercurial's one explicitly on the command line.
fields.summary: Mercurial shelve extension conflicts with SourceTree's Shelve function

fields.description:
Mercurial bookmarks are currently displayed in the GUI and I can update to the bookmarked revisions, but I cannot activate any bookmark and also I cannot add, move, or remove bookmarks in the GUI.  Currently, they only work as non-persistent tags.

I hope I can at least activate a bookmark when I update by choosing it so that I can use it as a branch in Git. I also hope I can add, move, and remove in the GUI.
fields.summary: Better Mercurial bookmask support

fields.description:
Click on any commit.  Click on any file within the commit.  Either right click and select "log selected", press shift-alt-l, or press Actions, Log Selected from the top menu.  Regardless, nothing appears to happen.

For some reason, the log windows were starting minimized.  An hour or so later as I was looking at something else within the windows taskbar I noticed that there were a bunch of minimized sourcetree windows. From my point of view it appeared that the log selected option was having no effect.  I think that it is starting them minimized if you previously minimized a log window, but I don't think that is a good design.  A person might minimize something and then later log something else, and I would expect that whenever I log something new that the new log window would not be minimized just because an older one was.
fields.summary: Log Selected Starts Minimized Window if Previous Window was minimized

fields.description:
The remote branch specified on the web site is always "master" regardless of which branch I select for "Remote branch" on the SourceTree "Create Pull Request" form.

It would be great if those two are matched.
fields.summary: Select the correct Branch on Web when creating pull request

fields.description:
See attached image. It shows the area of the ui that will trigger the radio button.
If a user misses the "Commit" button the "Push changes immediately to origin/master" is selected.
fields.summary: Click area for the option "Push changes immediately to origin/master" is too large

fields.description: The "Ignore" item is disappeared from context menu.
fields.summary: Can't ignore files

fields.description:
ST crashed badly when trying to select staged files to remove from the view.

Crash dump:
2015-02-12T18:41:26: Fatal error: 
System.ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null.
Parameter name: source

2015-02-12T18:41:26: Stack trace: 
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.Select[TSource,TResult](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 selector)
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.FileStatusViews.AbstractSelectableFileListViewModel._UnstageAll() in c:\projects\atlassian.com\dev\bitbucket.org\sourcetreewin\ViewModel\FileStatusViews\AbstractSelectableFileListViewModel.cs:line 733
   at System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.OnClick()
   at System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.OnMouseLeftButtonUp(MouseButtonEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeHandler(Delegate handler, Object target)

View: Log View

fields.summary: Sourcetree hangs in loghistory en memory skyrockets

fields.description:
Hi,

I don't really know what exactly happened, but these were the steps I took before SourceTree crashed:
1. Clone newly created repository from Stash(so empty repository)
2. Created Visual Studio project inside the checkout folder
3. Git changes weren't showing, so i closed the tab(the bookmark did say it had over 700 new files)
4. Reopened the repository tab, still no changes were showing
5. Pressed Commit
6. Checked the "Unstaged files" checkbox
7. SourceTree crashed

After I restarted SourceTree, my changes were showing and everything worked fine again.

Regards,
Guido
fields.summary: SourceTree Crash

fields.description: I was working with my project. Went to SourceTree window with my project opened. SourceTree refreshed and showed me current changes, also it marked my submodule as changed (I changed it indeed). I opened submodule and there were no pending changed files as usual. Just empty. I refreshed - nothing. Then I clicked on checkbox above the "Staged files" section, and it crashed.
fields.summary: Crash

fields.description:
It's really annoying when I watching changes in a file, sourctree just updates all commit list and details window.

Why should I break my work to wait while you refresh all the stuff in commit list ?

Usually, the current branch is my branch and noone change it and I don't care what's happening in other branches which can be shown in the commit list. 

So there's simple solution:

1. your company often use rebase: Turn on checker to check rebase changes in commit list.
2. your company does not use rebase at all. (this is my case) - do not refresh ALL list of commits, refresh only top of the list if there is new commits.

In case of 2: I could watch all prevous commits and not be scared that I could break it and wait while all list refreshes with THE SAME data.
fields.summary: Please do not update view-changes window when updating list of commits.

fields.description:
SourceTree GUI force a GUI background at some arbitrary place while it didn't before, making it show a white background at places while the system configuration may be the opposite.

Version 1.5.2 was using system's configuration for background color and didn't presented this problem.

See the screenshot to see what parts have an arbitrary background color (everything should be dark grey with my configuration)

If you don't want to use system configuration, please force the whole GUI in white and not random parts of it, sudden flashing things can be a health problem for some.

Please remove attachment once fixed.
fields.summary: GUI isn't using system configuration for background color

On Windows 7 Tools > Options > Git > Update Embeded Git  Fails with 'unable to extract'

fields.description:
I've switched on the full message output of the git console. (Tools > Options > General > Always display full console output)

I've noticed, when pulling changes into a branch, the console shows a syntax error:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin
\"C:/Program Files (x86)/GitExtensions/GitCredentialWinStore/git-credential-winstore.exe\" get: -c: line 0: syntax error near unexpected token `('

UPDATE:
This appears to be related to Git Extensions (also installed on my environment)
A resolution for this issue is posted at: https://lysandergg.wordpress.com/2014/06/21/git-extensions-syntax-error-near-unexpected-token/
fields.summary: git-credential-winstore.exe shows syntax error in console

fields.description:
When the setup is started through the 'check for update' function within SourceTree, it fails.
Stopping Sourcetree and starting the Setup from its download position works flawlessly.
fields.summary: An Exception occurs at the start of the installation if initiated from SourceTrees 'check for update'.

fields.description:
I liked to use Git through both cygwin and SourceTree on windows. If a repo's remote path is configured to use a unix path name then SourceTree is not able to push/pull. Conversely, if a windows pathname is configured then SourceTree is able to push/pull but it cannot be done through cygwin terminal. 

I would like to propose some feature that is able to detect cygwin/unix path name and convert them into windows pathnames automatically. That way push/pull to remote is still accessible through the cygwin terminal.
fields.summary: Unix(cygwin) path compatibility

fields.description: When attempting to connect to Stash on localhost, the dialog spins on "checking password". If I try to change my password, then the program crashes hard.
fields.summary: Crash when connecting to Stash on localhost

If files draws on different backgrounds depending on extension it should be helpfull to manipulate.

fields.description:
When viewing repositories on the "File Status" & "Log / History" Tabs. When unversioned/untracked files exist and are listed in the "Unstaged files" area, right clicking on them no longer lists "ignore" as an option.
Files can still be added to the ignore list via the Menu option -> Actions/Ignore.

This option was available in previous versions.
fields.summary: Re-introduce the Ignore option in Right-Click / Context Menu

fields.description:
During a push I was prompted for my userdetails. I accidentally got my username incorrect (typo). The GUI would not let me change the Username field following that.

I had to use the CLI to do my push.
fields.summary: Username Textbox Disabled After 1st Attempt

fields.description:
If the server returns a lot of text after a commit
(in my case, this was caused by a post-receive hook, which tried to run chmod -R on the working folder, but didn't have the rights for most files 
=> warning message for every other file)
SourceTree doesn't seem to be able to handle this.
It starts displaying all of the messages in the output window and very soon hangs and stops responding.
The only solution afterwards is to kill its process.

SourceTree should be able to only hold in its memory (and show in the output window) a limited number of response text it receives and forget the rest. Similarly as an SSH client would do.
fields.summary: freezes after push if server returns too much text

fields.description: crashes starting an corrupted project

fields.description:
When SourceTree for Windows updates via the built-in updater, the shortcut (like in the Windows task bar) becomes blank and can no longer launch SourceTree. It must be removed and re-added.
I have noticed since SourceTree for Windows updated to the current package installer.
fields.summary: Updater invalidates shortcut/link to app

fields.description:
Expected: I should be able to right click on an unstaged file (or multiple selected unstaged files) and add it to the index from the File Status tab.  
Observed: "Add to Index" is not in the list of options. "Unstage from index" is grayed out.  

I can stage files by checking the checkbox next to each file name.  The right-click to stage is especially useful when selecting multiple, but not all unstaged files.  

Screenshot: http://screencast.com/t/9PI4tVDq6UA
fields.summary: Cannot right click on unstaged file to add to index

fields.description:
I'm new to SourceTree and I'm new to git. I've been able to get things working for me for about a month now. I'm using a local (on a server) file as a hub--I'm not using GitHub. Everything used to work. I've recently moved, rearranged, and renamed some drives that hold repositories but I think It all worked since then when I pointed SourceTree to the new locations for the local and central repositories

Today, when I open SourceTree and it opens to a project called my-tools. I click the commit button in the upper left it crashes. Repeatedly... and on another PC (that looks at another instance of the same directory shared and synchronized using Google Drive and on which I haven't updated to the newest version) too). 

I just tried it on another project where it worked fine, so I expect that the .git file in the one project is corrupted. If so How do I fix it? and... of course... it shouldn't crash SourceTree.

I don't know how to find my java version
fields.summary: SourceTree 1.6.12.0 and 1.6.13.0 crash when I try to commit

fields.description:
If you use a Japanese environment, it is not possible to enter up.
On the IME are ready for full-width inputs, characters to be displayed Roman is input.
Although in other software can be double-byte input without any problems, can not be double-byte input only SourceTree.

Phenomenon confirmation IME: ATOK 2015, Microsoft Office IME 2010
fields.summary: Can not be input in Japanese.

fields.description:
Require optional switch to show all difference source lines in preview.
Current version, bottom of preview indicate "...", truncate code preview. Optional switch (in settings tab) enable/disable all code preview.
(Or, more better setting procedure)

* In my project, reviewing commit code difference in SourceTree, if all difference show in preview, it's more helpful.
fields.summary: Require optional switch to show all difference source lines in preview.

fields.description: When I attempt to Push commit of a few dozen files to the Stash-hosted Git repository, I receive the attached error indicating an authentication failure.
fields.summary: Authentication fails on Push to Stash

fields.description: Using the "checkout using Sourcetree" option in Stash, to checkout a large (10k files) repository over the network; Sourcetree becomes unresponsive.  The checkout actually succeeds.
fields.summary: Sourcetree hangs during checkout of large repository from Stash

fields.description:
When clicking on a commit with a large number of files (like, 60), the application freezes to a point of becoming unresponsive. Sometimes even to a point of forcing the user to forcefully close the application. 
This could be connected to connection problems, but nevertheless, it still is counter-productive and one should be able to stop the application from trying to load commit data, or not have it load at all (load on demand). This would speed up usage of the product significantly.
fields.summary: Application freezes when loading large commits

fields.description:
When finishing a hotfix (or a feature) it is posisble to tag your merge with a message. Then there is a tag with the name of your branch created along with your message.
It would be cool if you also can change the tag name for your merge. Like we're working with version-tags, it is unwanted to have named tags in our list.
Now we need to do that afterwards, manually. Would be great if that's build in the finish hotfix/feature window.
fields.summary: Ability to customize tag for Hotfix or feature
Crash on create repository

fields.description: When trying to commit for a specific repository source tree crashes
fields.summary: Source tree crash after trying to commit in a specific repository

fields.description: Lost current selection (Commit file lists in TreeView) when interval auto fetch process.
fields.summary: Lost current selection when interval auto fetch from git repositories.

fields.description:
#Create a new repository
#Add files -> SourceTree shows i.e. 176 new files in the lower pane
#Add .gitignore -> SourceTree shows 176 new files in the lower pane
#Modify .gitignore to exclude files -> SourceTree shows 176 new files in the lower pane

*Only a restart of SourceTree can force it to update the number!*
fields.summary: Summary pane is displaying the wrong number of new files

fields.description: When working on an active git repository where one would have to fetch/merge changes, When there are more than ~50 files changed/updated/removed SourceTree almost crash, it says not responding & windows is offering to kill the process (I resort to wait for program button) it takes around 2 to 3 minutes to calm down & get back into manageable state but not for long as long as I have the "merged branch ... into ... commit" it keeps lagging.
fields.summary: SourceTree Not Responding

fields.description: When dragging over folders in the treeview they expand immediately. please please please put a delay on that shizzle! If you, like me, have lots of folders, its just a pita, because  i have to close all the folders that auto-expanded when I dragged over. ;)
fields.summary: add a delay when expanding the folders when dragging over

fields.description:
We are using SourceTree to target our internal Stash server (version 3.4.3, 5000, not Data Center). The server is behind a nginx proxy. The base URL is: http://rndwww.foo.bar.net/git/

Problem:
nginx was flooded several time with SourceTree targetting a wrong url with at a very high rate (creating the first time a deny of service of nginx).
Example of wrong url:
http://rndwww.foo.bar.net/rest/api/1.0/users/kleboeuf/repos?limit=25
rate = 261 times per second

But the right url should be:
http://rndwww.foo.bar.net/git/rest/api/1.0/users/kleboeuf/repos?limit=25

The problem was reported a few minutes after an update of SourceTree. Unfortunately, I don't know the previous version. The guy was pushing and he had to stop SourceTree as it was frozen. No error message.
fields.summary: SourceTree queries Stash on wrong URL with a very high rate (>250 tps)

fields.description:
The pull command has an option to use rebase instead of merge.
Unfortunately there is no way to specify the option "--preserve-merge" of the rebase command (or the option --rebase=preserve of the pull command).

So if you use this command after a merge from an release branch into the master branch on the master branch, your merge gets lost.

Would be great to have another option in the pull dialog which allows you to specify to preserve merges.
fields.summary: preserve-merge for pull command using rebase

fields.description:
I changed my system password (and login password to Stash). But I cannot update the new password in SourceTree. Even with the Tools->Options->Authentication.
The thing is, I had a "CAPTCHA" error at first. I cleared the error by logging out and re-log-in the Stash. But when I did something in SourceTree(fetch/pull/clone), I had a "Authentication failed" error. And the same thing happened when I tried to connect to the Stash repository (error said it is not a valid repository).
I solved the problem at last by deleting all the data under C\Users\...\AppData\Local\Atlassian and re-installed the SourceTree. It seems this is the only way to clear all the saved credentials and reset the password for Stash.
fields.summary: Failed to change the Stash password without wiping the saved credentials

fields.description:
Note: This is for the BETA Stream v1.6.13002.0 (Which wasn't in the list)

I'm having a problem where the diff view will not update correctly in some circumstances.

Steps:

1) Go to File Status View With some changes in your working copy
2) Select Split-View Staging
3) Stage some files
4) Click on a staged file
5) Click on an unstaged file

Expected Result:

Diff view updates to represent the unstaged file's changes

Actual Result:

Loading spinner shows briefly and the staged file's changes remain visible.

Changing the staged file selected will update this diff, but no unstaged file will show up.
fields.summary: Diff View not Updating for Unstaged Files In Beta Stream

fields.description:
I'm trying out SourceTree, previously used TortoiseHg.

I love SourceTree in terms of how nice the UI is, but one thing I noticed is on the commit map if you close a branch, the icon looks the same as a regular commit, whereas in TortoiseHg it uses a different graphic to help illustrate this difference better.

Be nice if SourceTree could follow in the same direction.
fields.summary: Use a new symbol to illustrate a closed branch.

fields.description:
The application can't save my bitbucket username / password informations.

Infos:
- When I go to Edit Hosting Account and enter username and password I get the error message "Unable to save password" relative to cryptography (screenshot attached).
- I have a password set to my account on Bitbucket (unless I am missing something) and I have tried to change it but it doesn't resolve the issue.

I found similarities with this issue, although in my case the application doesn't crash: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-1153

Thank you for your help.
fields.summary: Authentication to Bitbucket username is failing & unable to save password (crypto issue)

fields.description:
Currently if a make a commit, and later a second commit with message "fixup! <message of first commit>", SourceTree will fail to show the interactive rebase dialog. The rebase waiting dialog open and the progress bar turns indefinitely. 

See [Git doc|http://git-scm.com/docs/git-commit] for explanations about fixup and autosquash features.

see also feature request [1617|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1617] to support  fixup
fields.summary: SourceTree fails to show the interactive rebase dialog if there are "fixup" commits

fields.description: Can't update embedded GIT from 1.8.3 to 1.9.5 because of 7z error during decompression (see attached image).
fields.summary: Can't update embedded GIT from 1.8.3 to 1.9.5

fields.description:
Using SourceTree, sorting the staged files in Tree View.

2015-01-30T17:09:42: SingleInstance called with arguments: System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]
2015-01-30T18:27:30: Fatal error: 
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.

2015-01-30T18:27:30: Stack trace: 
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.FileStatusViews.FileStatusDetailView.GetAllLeafNodePaths(IEnumerable`1 nodes, Nullable`1 type, Nullable`1 status, Boolean selectedNodesOnly, Boolean checkboxesEnabledOnly) in c:\Projects\atlassian.com\dev\sourcetreewin\ViewModel\FileStatusViews\IFileStatusDetailView.cs:line 730
fields.summary: SourceTree Crash
If you create a duplicate folder (same name) and delete the duplicate the wrong folder is deleted
The Check for Update option is broken in the Beta stream

fields.description:
SourceTree will show me textual diffs of changed .doc and .pdf files before I commit.

After committing changes, looking at history and selecting a .doc or .pdf file only shows buttons to "Open Before" and "Open After". I'd really like to see the textual diff just like before the commit.
fields.summary: Show diffs for .doc and .pdf files when viewing history

fields.description:
This is related to SRCTREEWIN-1510, but it's a separate problem.

When I click a branch name in the Branches list, that branch name and the HEAD commit for that branch in the commit list are highlighted in exactly the same color. There is no way to distinguish which of these two views has keyboard focus.

When a branch is clicked in the Branches list, the selected commit in the commit list should be highlighted using a different color to indicate that the commit list does not have keyboard focus. Most applications use a light grey for the selection highlight in a component which does not have keyboard focus.

Additionally, when the Branches list has keyboard focus, pressing Tab to move the keyboard focus to the commit list doesn't move the keyboard focus to the commit that was highlighted by selecting a branch in the Branches list. Instead the keyboard focus moves to the commit that was last clicked on (or navigated to using the arrow keys) in the commit list. This could be very far away from the commit that the user just brought into view by selecting a branch.
fields.summary: Inconsistent Keyboard Focus and Selection Highlights

fields.description:
*WAY TO REPRODUCE:*
1. Have 2 repos bookmarked on Sourcetree
2. Add a subtree into the Repo 1 (E.g: include repository "myLib1.git" into folder "lib1")
3. Add another subtree to Repo 2 (E.g: include repository "myLib2.git" into folder "lib2")
4. Right-clicking "lib1" in Repo 1 and choose "Details" will show the details of "lib2" in Repo 2
5. Subtree pull in repo 1 -> nothing seems to happen but actually "lib2" is pulled in Repo 2
fields.summary: Problems using git subtree in several bookmarked working copies

fields.description:
Filenames containing Cyrillic are displayed correctly.
Screenshot: http://screencast.com/t/zAZjvOOHbi
fields.summary: Cyrillic in file names

fields.description:
Please see screenshot: http://screencloud.net/v/k6tN
It appears any non-truncated/elipsis paths are backslash correctly, but any truncated/ellipsis paths are forward slashed creating a visual inconsistency.
fields.summary: Inconsistent backslashes and forwardslashes for paths in commit tree view

fields.description: I am using SourceTree 1.6.12.0 on Windows 7 64-bit. When I try Help > Check for Updates, I receive the error in the summary line.
fields.summary: Error: "Checking for Updates - Cannot create a file when that file already exists."

fields.description: When working with multiple projects in SourceTree, I frequently am left with many tabs open. The only way to close many tabs is to click the X at the top of each tab. It would be really useful - and consistent with other tabbed interfaces to have a "close all" option or a "close all but this" option when right-clicking a tab.
fields.summary: Close all tabs option

fields.description: Pressing the Commit button (or beginning to write in the Commit text box at the bottom of the screen) causes a crash. Seems to happen regardless of what sort of file is staged for committing. Also crashes if no file is staged for commit.
fields.summary: Crash when selecting Commit

fields.description:
Any time there's a conflict during interactive rebase, the Close button on the output window for the interactive rebase immediately aborts the rebase.

To reproduce:
* Initiate an interactive rebase with a known conflict [0]
* Observe the output window with normal message "error: could not apply..."
* Expected result: click the Close button and be presented with the opportunity to resolve the conflict(s) and continue the rebase
* Actual result: click the Close button and rebase is immediately aborted

See also SRCTREEWIN-2715 which has a slightly misleading description.

[0] Clone https://bitbucket.org/malingo/srctreewin-2912 and attempt to interactive rebase 'other-branch' onto 'master'
fields.summary: Interactive rebase with conflict always aborts

fields.description:
My team has noticed a few times where a feature branch has been created with a sub-directory specified. When the branch is checked out in SourceTree, a second branch is created and commits push to the new branch instead of the originally-created branch

{panel:title=Repro steps}
# BitBucket: Create a branch “Something/foo” (uppercase 'S')
# SourceTree: Fetch; check out “Something/foo”
# BitBucket: Create a branch “something/bar” (lowercase 's')
# SourceTree: Fetch; check out “something/bar”
# Make any change to working copy (something/bar)
# SourceTree: Commit; push -> Creates “Something/bar” (uppercase 'S')
{panel}
fields.summary: SourceTree creates a duplicate branche

fields.description: The sidebar (file status, branches, tags, remotes, stashes) doesn't scroll horizontally using a scrollwheel that can 'tick' to the sides. This scrollwheel works fine in most applications.
fields.summary: Horizontal scroll in the sidebar doesn't work

fields.description:
To reproduce:

- Make some changes on a file.
- Open the Discard view.
- No files are shown there that has been changed.

Workaround:

Open the commit view, and right click on the changed file and you can discard it.
fields.summary: The Discard view Does not show changed files

fields.description:
When I launch the SourceTree Installer it gets through the installation configuration options and starts the install until it eventually hangs Windows and I have to hard reset the laptop. 

I have previously had SourceTree installed on this laptop and am re-installing as we are looking to roll this out as our recommended tool with Stash. 

Machine Info:
Lenovo Thinkpad X1 Carbon
Windows 8.1 Pro
Core i7 4600u CPU
8GB DDR3 RAM
240GB SSD
fields.summary: SourceTree installer hangs Windows 8.1 during install process

fields.description:
Running the latest version of SourceTree on Windows 7 & 8.1 I cannot get the external diff tool to launch to resolve conflicts. I have tried both BeyondCompare 3 and DiffMerge 4.2.0. 

I see the 4 file comparison files being created and the dialog box pop up with the merge details but the external tool doesn't launch. The external tool does launch successfully for the standard compare function.
fields.summary: SourceTree will not open external diff tool to resolve conflicts

fields.description: It would be nice to have a feature where i can associate some todos with a commit ... such todos appear in a dialog box to anyone pulling past that commit. This can be achieved by say using a specified format in commit message.. ex. TODONOTE: "run gradle eclipse"
fields.summary: An event publishing facility

fields.description:
In some languages (such as Python and CoffeeScript) the whitespaces at the beginning of the line is important. These languages are indentation-agnostic and the level of indentation specifies the scope.

It would be great to have an option to make ignore-whitespace more intelligent. For Python and CoffeeScript files it could ignore the whitespaces at the end of a line or file, but it does show the whitespace differences at the beginning of the lines.
fields.summary: Make 'ignore whitespace' language aware

fields.description:
Cloned an existing TFS server (along with all commits and comments) to Git using Git-Tf.  Created a new repository on BitBucket, then committed the newly created local Git repo to it.  Upon trying to clone the repo to another machine using SourceTree (v 1.6.12, dl'ed from sourcetreeapp.com) the master branch would clone, but the UI would hang, and the RAM used would go over 2GB (sometimes up to 3GB in come cases).

Uninstalled 1.6.12 (along with all local app data) then installed 1.5.2.  Cloned repo again with no issues.  Created a few commits to master branch, and initialized git-flow.  Updated software to 1.6.12.  Noticed no hanging issues.  When I highlighted the initial commit (from previous paragraph) the same hanging occurred, which led me to believe that the UI was hanging because needing to list over 2500 files in the Log/History window.
fields.summary: Commit with over 2500 files causes GUI to hang
